SENT.plain: PURPOSE: To perform a reliable non-invasive detection of the fetal achondroplasia using maternal plasma
METHODS: We developed a quantitative fluorescent-polymerase chain reaction (QF-PCR) method suitable for detection of the FGFR3 mutation (G1138A) causing achondroplasia
This method was applied in a non-invasive detection of the fetal achondroplasia using circulating fetal-DNA (cf-DNA) in maternal plasma
Maternal plasmas were obtained at 27 weeks of gestational age from women carrying an achondroplasia fetus or a normal fetus
RESULTS: Two percent or less achondroplasia DNA was reliably detected by QF-PCR
In a woman carrying a normal fetus, analysis of cf-DNA showed only one peak of the wild-type G allele
In a woman expected an achondroplasia fetus, analysis of cf-DNA showed the two peaks of wild-type G allele and mutant-type A allele and accurately detected the fetal achondroplasia
CONCLUSIONS: The non-invasive method using maternal plasma and QF-PCR may be useful for diagnosis of the fetal achondroplasia
